comment: great interface, nice styling ... if mostly useless. Let me clarify, on trying to add a show through the app, it adds to a queue, which God alone knows where is. Might be a simple setting to find, but undocumented it seems.
You can add shows by clicking the add icon in the action bar, it is represented by a plus (+) icon, it's the first of the three icons.

title: Solid app
comment: Works great when I don't want to remote into my server from PC. Brilliant, thanks.
O

title: Crashes sickrage
comment: Is this crashing sickrage latest for anyone else

title: Sickrage
comment: The first time you set up a profile you have to do so without the banners option checked or it will break your Web interface. After you gets your shows initially loaded you can enable banners. 4 stars for that minor trouble
Thank you for the information on how to replicate that error, I'll be investigating that bug and trying to patch it up for a future update.

title: Works well. Wish it supported Sonarr
comment: One bug I see often... Sometimes shows don't display episodes.

title: Easy setup.
comment: Was even able to use hostname instead of IP during setup.

title: 3G/4G Access
comment: Great app. Works flawlessly when I'm connected to my wifi. Would love to know how to access over my mobile 4G network....??

title: Love it
comment: Works great with sickrage not a worry in the world. Setup was nice and easy, although if there was a 'next' button during the setup it would be a lot less confusing as to what to do when you've filled everything out.

title: Great
comment: Working absolutely fine with SickRage.

title: Good app
comment: A couple more features (more sorting and show editing options) would get  this 5 stars but this is pretty good as it is.

title: Convenience
comment: Very handy for mobile access

title: Love it
comment: Works perfectly!

title: Help
comment: Hi there, I have given five stars because I used to use this app with sickbeard.  I made the switch to sickrage and i cant connect ever since. Any pointers?  I d love to be able to use this wonderful app again.
Hey Clint, DroidBeard supports Sick Rage, so you shouldn't have any issues. Could you drop by the Google+ page and provide some further information on your setup?

title: Great app,  does everything!
comment: Thank you devs for this wonderful app!  ssl connection works flawlessly even behind router with port forwarding (for those having doubts)
Thanks Dominiek, much appreciated :)

title: Doesn't work
comment: Can't connect to my sickbeard at all.  An example would be nice, but it's not available.  But it's simple setup, and plugging in all the parameters -> no connection

If it was you that sent the last error report, it is due to an SSL issue on your server; without a working setup there is nothing the app can do to work around that. It seems you have rated various other download management apps as 1 star with the same reason, these will also not work if your server setup isn't done properly.

title: Can view but can't add
comment: Searching for any show returns no results so it's impossible to add a new show. Will give a 5 when that's working though!
Hey Scott, this has been reported by a few Sick Rage users, as Sick Rage uses a slightly different API to Sick Beard. An update should be ready in the next week or two to fix this though.
Works now with sickrage

title: Great app
comment: Seems to work really well, although it doesn't bring up any shows to add when I search. Also a UI option to match sick rage would be awesome.
Works great!

title: Very promising lightweight app
comment: Works very well, even with SickRage. I love its minimalism and responsiveness.  I'm missing the option of setting the app to go to a different address when connected to a specific WiFi network so I can use it freely at home and on the go without needing to change the server address in the settings.

Thanks for the feedback :) Adding profiles so you can switch between different Sick Beard servers is on the list of things to do at the moment and I'll be making it so you can automatically switch to a profile when you have connected to a specific network.

title: Great work
comment: Nice app to talk to your sick Beard server
Thank you :) got more big improvements on the way!

title: Slow to update
comment: I would love it if it didn't take so long to update

title: Amazing, Well Done. Just feels right...
comment: I've only just started using it and while there are a few features or options I would like I gotta say this app is awesome. I used to use Sick Stache' which don't get me wrong is awesome as well. Both apps work really well and in the same capacity, however this app has smooth loading / transition screens, and the overall pages are designed to look like the web interface, versus some native android app. Well Done...  Update: To the Developer, thanks for the reply. Please let me know if you need any help. I do graphic design, web design, css, etc. I also and very good at generating ideas and making things user friendly, polished, as I come from a design background.

Thank you very much, making the look and feel be comparable to Sick Beard itself was a big goal I had set for the app, so I'm glad that you like it :) I'm going to be adding more features to it over the coming months and will hopefully have something that can completely replace the web based interface.

title: Great app
comment: Great work as per usual keep it up ratsating

title: Very Useful
comment: Very useful, would highly recommend it.

title: This app changed my life
comment: It really has, when I'm on public transport I can queue up shows that pop into my mind, in the past day everyone at work commented on how unproductive I was being and then I showed them this app. Then everyone started doing that slow 80s clap, I even think one guy started crying with happiness. I hope that one day I meet rastating so I can subject him to my long embrace (no-homo)
